meta.title: The Flood and the Fire
meta.narrative_story: The Water and the Fire had a truce, until the River got drunk on Juice. The STREAM flowed through A STATE that had always obeyed the water's will. To live by the stream, you learned TO OBEY. There was no other way. WATER was everything here. Life. Death. Law. It had existed for ETERNITY — long before memory, long before names. The stream had one REQUEST: to return to the SPRING where it was born. It crossed the FLATLANDS with this single WISH driving it forward. Then the rains came. Water began TO WASH AWAY everything in its path. Towns. Temples. Memories. Those who could SWIM survived. Those who couldn't became part of the current. The flood carved a CONTINENT, reshaped MARSHES, scattered SAND across former kingdoms. The great YANGTZE swelled with pride. JUICE from crushed orchards mixed with the surge. The TIDE came in. The tide refused to go out. From this chaos, a new SOURCE emerged — water finding its level. Life became LIVELY again, then threatened TO EXTINGUISH. The SITUATION was dire. Every RIVER and LAKE was in revolt. None could FATHOM how to stop it. SOIL tried to hold the line. It measured each wave with EQUAL desperation. The earth's BELLY filled with water. Workers tried TO FILL IN the breaches. The land tried TO SPIT the water back. 'WAAAH!' cried the villages, one CHINESE INCH at a time disappearing. The elders tried TO SEAL the rivers with prayer. In the BUDDHIST TEMPLE, monks sat in meditation. TIME meant nothing to them. Then came FIRE. It rose from the south, turning water to ASHES. The survivors were VEXED — which disaster was worse? INFLAMMATION spread — two fires stacked, angry and hot. Where fire and water met, things became THIN — watery, bland, exhausted. DISASTER seemed endless. But then a single flame learned TO ILLUMINATE instead of destroy. In the calm waters that remained, A FISH appeared. People began FISHING — the first meal after the catastrophe. The legendary YÁO brought FEVER to cook what was caught. And at last, DAWN broke — fire and water reconciled in the morning light. The truce was restored. Until the next time someone got drunk on juice.
meta.narrative_arc: An elemental war between water and fire, ending in reconciliation at dawn

characters.narrative_position: The STREAM flowed through a state that had always obeyed the water's will
characters.etymology: Pictograph of water flowing in three channels
characters.pithy_formula: The STREAM flows endlessly - I SING 'CHWAHHHHN!' riding the current.
characters.story: I ride the STREAM through three rushing channels, SINGING 'CHWAHHHHN!' in a sustained note. The water carries me endlessly - my voice holds high as currents merge.

characters.narrative_position: The stream flowed through A STATE that had always obeyed the water's will
characters.etymology: Stream (川) + islands = state (land among rivers)
characters.pithy_formula: The STATE rises from water - I SING 'JOHHHH!' surveying my territory.
characters.story: I survey my STATE rising from the waters, SINGING 'JOHHHH!' in sustained triumph. Islands dot the streams - my province spreads across the wet landscape.

similar_warning.repulsion: 州 = STATE (stream + dots); 洲 = CONTINENT (water radical + state)

characters.narrative_position: To live by the stream, you learned TO OBEY — there was no other way
characters.etymology: Stream (川) + head/page = obey (head bowing like water flowing)
characters.pithy_formula: I OBEY without resistance - I COMMAND 'SHWUN!' bowing smoothly.
characters.story: I OBEY the order without resistance, COMMANDING 'SHWUN!' as I bow smoothly. Like water flowing downhill - sharp submission, no friction, pure compliance.

characters.narrative_position: WATER was everything here — life, death, law
characters.etymology: Pictograph of water splashing and flowing
characters.pithy_formula: WATER surrounds me - I GROAN 'Shwayyy...' drowning slowly.
characters.story: WATER fills my lungs and I GROAN 'Shwayyy...' in low, creaky desperation. Drowning slowly - the zombie sinks deeper, my voice bubbling up in agony.

characters.narrative_position: It had existed for ETERNITY — long before memory, long before names
characters.etymology: Extended water symbol = eternity (water flows forever)
characters.pithy_formula: ETERNITY stretches endlessly - I GROAN 'Yohnggg...' trapped forever.
characters.story: ETERNITY stretches before me and I GROAN 'Yohnggg...' in low, creaky horror. Trapped FOREVER - the zombie existence never ends, my voice drags on eternally.

similar_warning.repulsion: 永 = ETERNITY (abstract forever); 泳 = SWIM (water + eternity = swim forever)

characters.narrative_position: The stream had one REQUEST: to return to the spring where it was born
characters.etymology: Modified water = to seek (searching for water)
characters.pithy_formula: I REQUEST desperately - I GASP 'CHYOH?!' begging for help!
characters.story: I REQUEST water desperately, GASPING 'CHYOH?!' in rising panic. Please, I beg! My voice climbs as thirst consumes me - seeking, pleading, beseeching!

characters.narrative_position: The stream had one request: to return to the SPRING where it was born
characters.etymology: White (白) + water (水) = spring (clear water emerging)
characters.pithy_formula: The SPRING bubbles up - I GASP 'CHWAN?!' finding fresh water!
characters.story: The SPRING bubbles up from underground and I GASP 'CHWAN?!' in rising amazement. Fresh water! My voice climbs as I discover the precious source.

characters.narrative_position: It crossed the FLATLANDS with this single wish driving it forward
characters.etymology: Cliff (厂) + spring (泉) = plain (flat land where springs emerge)
characters.pithy_formula: The PLAIN stretches out - I GASP 'YWAN?!' at the vast ORIGINAL landscape!
characters.story: The ORIGINAL PLAIN stretches before me and I GASP 'YWAN?!' in rising wonder. Vast flatlands where springs emerge - my voice climbs surveying this primordial expanse.

similar_warning.repulsion: 原 = PLAIN/original (cliff + spring); 源 = SOURCE (water + plain)

characters.narrative_position: It crossed the flatlands with this single WISH driving it forward
characters.etymology: Original (原) + head (頁) = wish (original thought in the head)
characters.pithy_formula: I make my WISH - I COMMAND 'YWAN!' demanding it come true!
characters.story: I make my WISH and COMMAND 'YWAN!' with sharp determination. Grant this! My bark echoes as I demand the universe bend to my original desire.

characters.narrative_position: Water began TO WASH AWAY everything in its path — towns, temples, memories
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + middle (中) = rinse (water rushing through)
characters.pithy_formula: Water RUSHES through - I SING 'CHOHHHNG!' as it RINSES everything clean!
characters.story: Water RUSHES through and RINSES everything clean. I SING 'CHOHHHNG!' in a sustained note as the flood carries away debris - my voice holds high in the torrent.

characters.narrative_position: Those who could SWIM survived — those who couldn't became part of the current
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + eternity (永) = swim (moving through water forever)
characters.pithy_formula: I SWIM through endless water - I GROAN 'Yohnggg...' exhausted strokes.
characters.story: I SWIM through endless water, GROANING 'Yohnggg...' in low, creaky exhaustion. Stroke after stroke for eternity - the zombie swims on, voice dragging through each breath.

similar_warning.repulsion: 泳 = SWIM (water + eternity); 永 = ETERNITY (abstract concept)

characters.narrative_position: The flood carved a CONTINENT and reshaped marshes
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + state (州) = continent (large landmass in water)
characters.pithy_formula: The CONTINENT rises from oceans - I SING 'JOHHHH!' claiming the landmass!
characters.story: The CONTINENT rises from surrounding oceans and I SING 'JOHHHH!' in sustained triumph. Massive landmass - my voice holds high as I claim this vast territory.

similar_warning.repulsion: 洲 = CONTINENT (water + state = larger); 州 = STATE (smaller territory)

characters.narrative_position: The flood carved a continent and reshaped MARSHES
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + summon (召) = marsh (water that summons/traps you)
characters.pithy_formula: The MARSH sucks me down - I GROAN 'Jowww...' sinking into muck.
characters.story: The MARSH sucks me down and I GROAN 'Jowww...' in low, creaky terror. Swamp water pulls at my legs - the zombie sinks deeper into the muck.

characters.narrative_position: The flood scattered SAND across former kingdoms
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + few (少) = sand (where water is scarce, only sand remains)
characters.pithy_formula: SAND spreads across the shore - I SING 'SHAHHHH!' as waves wash grains.
characters.story: SAND spreads across the endless shore and I SING 'SHAHHHH!' in a sustained whisper. Waves wash countless grains - my voice hisses like wind over dunes.

similar_warning.repulsion: 沙 = SAND (water + few); 砂 = GRAVEL (stone + few)

characters.narrative_position: The great YANGTZE swelled with pride
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + work (工) = river (water that does work, great rivers)
characters.pithy_formula: The great RIVER flows - I SING 'JYAHHHNG!' at the mighty Yangtze!
characters.story: The mighty RIVER flows with tremendous power and I SING 'JYAHHHNG!' in sustained awe. The Yangtze works endlessly - my voice holds high honoring this great water.

similar_warning.repulsion: 江 = great RIVER (Yangtze, T1 singing majesty); 河 = river (general, T2 questioning)

characters.narrative_position: JUICE from crushed orchards mixed with the surge
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + ten (十) = juice (concentrated liquid essence)
characters.pithy_formula: The JUICE drips down - I SING 'JIHHHH!' savoring the sweet liquid!
characters.story: Sweet JUICE drips down my chin and I SING 'JIHHHH!' in sustained pleasure. The concentrated liquid bursts with flavor - my voice holds high in pure delight.

characters.narrative_position: The TIDE came in — the tide refused to go out
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + dynasty/morning (朝) = tide (water that comes and goes like dynasties)
characters.pithy_formula: The TIDE rushes in - I GASP 'CHOW?!' as waves approach!
characters.story: The TIDE rushes in unexpectedly and I GASP 'CHOW?!' in rising alarm. Waves approach faster than expected - my voice climbs as water chases my feet!

characters.narrative_position: From this chaos, a new SOURCE emerged — water finding its level
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + original (原) = source (where water originates)
characters.pithy_formula: I find the SOURCE - I GASP 'YWAN?!' discovering the origin!
characters.story: I find the SOURCE of the great river and GASP 'YWAN?!' in rising amazement. The original spring! My voice climbs as I discover where it all begins.

similar_warning.repulsion: 源 = SOURCE (water + original); 原 = PLAIN/original (no water radical)

characters.narrative_position: Life became LIVELY again, then threatened to extinguish
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + tongue (舌) = alive (water and speaking = living)
characters.pithy_formula: I'm ALIVE with energy - I GASP 'HWOH?!' feeling life surge through me!
characters.story: I'm ALIVE with surging energy and GASP 'HWOH?!' in rising wonder. Blood pumps, heart beats - my voice climbs as life itself courses through my veins!

characters.narrative_position: Life became lively again, then threatened TO EXTINGUISH
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + resemble (肖) = extinguish (water makes fire disappear)
characters.pithy_formula: The flame EXTINGUISHES - I SING 'SHYOWWW!' as it DISAPPEARS!
characters.story: I throw water and the flame EXTINGUISHES instantly. I SING 'SHYOWWW!' in a sustained hiss as fire DISAPPEARS - my voice fades like the dying embers.

characters.narrative_position: The SITUATION was dire — every river and lake was in revolt
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + elder brother (兄) = situation (conditions that flow)
characters.pithy_formula: The SITUATION is dire - I COMMAND 'KWAHNG!' assessing conditions!
characters.story: The SITUATION is dire and I COMMAND 'KWAHNG!' with sharp authority assessing the conditions. Water rising, time short - my bark demands immediate action!

characters.narrative_position: Every RIVER and lake was in revolt
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + can (可) = river (water that can flow anywhere)
characters.pithy_formula: The RIVER blocks my path - I GASP 'HUH?!' How do I cross?!
characters.story: The RIVER blocks my path and I GASP 'HUH?!' in rising confusion. How do I cross this rushing water? My voice climbs as I search for a way over.

similar_warning.repulsion: 河 = RIVER (general, T2 questioning); 江 = great RIVER (Yangtze, T1 singing majesty)

characters.narrative_position: Every river and LAKE was in revolt
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + reckless (胡) = lake (wild water that stays put)
characters.pithy_formula: The LAKE stretches before me - I GASP 'HOO?!' at its mysterious depths!
characters.story: The LAKE stretches before me with mysterious depths. I GASP 'HOO?!' in rising wonder - what lurks below? My voice climbs as I peer into dark water.

characters.narrative_position: None could FATHOM how to stop it
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + rule (則) = measure (using rules to measure water depth)
characters.pithy_formula: I MEASURE the depth - I COMMAND 'TSUH!' dropping the line!
characters.story: I MEASURE the water depth and COMMAND 'TSUH!' sharply dropping the weighted line. FATHOM by fathom - my bark counts each mark as the rope descends.

characters.narrative_position: SOIL tried to hold the line against the flood
characters.etymology: Pictograph of earth piled in a mound
characters.pithy_formula: I dig into SOIL - I GROAN 'Tooo...' burying myself in earth.
characters.story: I dig into the SOIL and GROAN 'Tooo...' in low, creaky labor. Burying myself in cold earth - the zombie finds home in the dirt, voice muffled by mud.

similar_warning.repulsion: 土 = SOIL (wide base, T3 groan); 士 = SCHOLAR (narrow base, T4 command)

characters.narrative_position: It measured each wave with EQUAL desperation
characters.etymology: Earth (土) + even (勻) = equal (leveling the ground)
characters.pithy_formula: I make everything EQUAL - I SING 'JYOOOON!' leveling the ground!
characters.story: I make everything EQUAL, SINGING 'JYOOOON!' in a sustained note as I level the ground. Even, fair, balanced - my voice holds high as all becomes the same.

characters.narrative_position: The earth's BELLY filled with water
characters.etymology: Flesh (月) + earth (土) = belly (the earthen container of flesh)
characters.moon_flesh_note: 月 here means FLESH, not moon
characters.pithy_formula: My BELLY rumbles - I COMMAND 'DOO!' demanding food now!
characters.story: My BELLY rumbles with fierce hunger. I COMMAND 'DOO!' with sharp urgency demanding food now! The flesh container growls - my bark insists on being fed.

characters.narrative_position: Workers tried TO FILL IN the breaches
characters.etymology: Earth (土) + true (真) = fill in (truly filling with earth)
characters.pithy_formula: I FILL IN the hole - I GASP 'TYEN?!' as dirt piles up!
characters.story: I FILL IN the gaping hole with dirt, GASPING 'TYEN?!' in rising effort. Shovel after shovel - my voice climbs as the pit slowly disappears under earth.

characters.narrative_position: The land tried TO SPIT the water back
characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + earth (土) = spit (expelling dirt from mouth)
characters.pithy_formula: I SPIT out filth - I GROAN 'Tooo...' retching miserably.
characters.story: I SPIT out the filth and GROAN 'Tooo...' in low, creaky misery. Retching up dirt - the zombie vomits earth, my voice dragging through each heave.

characters.narrative_position: 'WAAAH!' cried the villages as they disappeared
characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + jade (圭) = wow (exclamation of amazement)
characters.pithy_formula: WOW! I SING 'WAHHHH!' in pure amazement!
characters.story: WOW! The sight takes my breath away and I SING 'WAHHHH!' in a sustained note of pure amazement. Incredible - my voice holds high in childlike wonder!

characters.narrative_position: One CHINESE INCH at a time the villages were disappearing
characters.etymology: Pictograph of hand with pulse point = inch (pulse is one inch from wrist)
characters.pithy_formula: I measure one INCH - I COMMAND 'TSOON!' marking the precise spot!
characters.story: I measure one INCH from my wrist and COMMAND 'TSOON!' marking the precise spot. Exact, sharp - my bark demands accuracy down to the smallest measure.

characters.narrative_position: The elders tried TO SEAL the rivers with prayer
characters.etymology: Earth (土土) + inch (寸) = seal (piling earth to seal borders)
characters.pithy_formula: I SEAL the envelope - I SING 'FUNGGGG!' pressing it closed!
characters.story: I SEAL the envelope tightly and SING 'FUNGGGG!' in a sustained note pressing it closed. Locked, secured - my voice holds high as the wax hardens.

characters.narrative_position: In the BUDDHIST TEMPLE, monks sat in meditation
characters.etymology: Earth (土) + inch (寸) = temple (sacred ground measured precisely)
characters.pithy_formula: The TEMPLE stands sacred - I COMMAND 'SIH!' with solemn respect!
characters.story: The Buddhist TEMPLE stands on sacred ground. I COMMAND 'SIH!' with sharp solemnity and bow my head. Holy earth - my bark echoes in reverent halls.

similar_warning.repulsion: 寺 = TEMPLE (sacred place); 時 = TIME (sun + temple = measuring time)

characters.narrative_position: TIME meant nothing to them in meditation
characters.etymology: Sun (日) + temple (寺) = time (temples measured time by sun)
characters.pithy_formula: TIME passes quickly - I GASP 'SHIH?!' Where did the hours go?!
characters.story: TIME passes too quickly! I GASP 'SHIH?!' in rising panic - where did the hours go?! My voice climbs as I realize I'm late, sun already setting.

similar_warning.repulsion: 時 = TIME (sun + temple); 寺 = TEMPLE (sacred place alone)

characters.narrative_position: Then came FIRE — it rose from the south
characters.etymology: Pictograph of flames rising from burning wood
characters.pithy_formula: FIRE burns me - I GROAN 'Hwohh...' in smoldering agony.
characters.story: FIRE burns my flesh and I GROAN 'Hwohh...' in low, creaky agony. Flames lick my skin - the zombie smolders, my voice dragging through the pain.

characters.narrative_position: Fire rose from the south, turning water to ASHES
characters.etymology: Fire (火) + hand = ash (what remains after fire, held in hand)
characters.pithy_formula: ASH crumbles in my fingers - I SING 'HWAYYYY!' watching it scatter.
characters.story: ASH crumbles through my fingers and I SING 'HWAYYYY!' in a sustained note watching it scatter. GRAY dust floats away - my voice holds high as remains drift.

characters.narrative_position: The survivors were VEXED — which disaster was worse?
characters.etymology: Fire (火) + head (頁) = vexed (fire in the head = frustrated)
characters.pithy_formula: I'm so VEXED - I GASP 'FAHN?!' Why won't this work?!
characters.story: I'm so VEXED I could scream! I GASP 'FAHN?!' in rising frustration - why won't this work?! Fire burns in my head, my voice climbing with each failed attempt!

characters.narrative_position: INFLAMMATION spread — two fires stacked, angry and hot
characters.etymology: Fire (火) + fire (火) = inflammation (double fire = intense heat)
characters.pithy_formula: INFLAMMATION burns inside - I GASP 'YEN?!' at the fever heat!
characters.story: INFLAMMATION burns inside my joints! I GASP 'YEN?!' in rising alarm at the fever heat. Double fire - my voice climbs as the swelling intensifies!

characters.narrative_position: Where fire and water met, things became THIN — watery, bland, exhausted
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + flame (炎) = bland (water weakens fire = diluted)
characters.pithy_formula: The taste is BLAND - I COMMAND 'DAHN!' This needs more flavor!
characters.story: The taste is utterly BLAND! I COMMAND 'DAHN!' with sharp disgust - this needs more flavor! Water has diluted everything - my bark demands intensity!

characters.narrative_position: DISASTER seemed endless
characters.etymology: Roof (宀) + fire (火) = disaster (fire under roof = catastrophe)
characters.pithy_formula: DISASTER strikes my home - I SING 'DZAIII!' as flames engulf the roof!
characters.story: DISASTER strikes as fire engulfs my home! I SING 'DZAIII!' in a sustained wail watching the roof burn. Calamity - my voice holds through the smoke and terror.

characters.narrative_position: A single flame learned TO ILLUMINATE instead of destroy
characters.etymology: Sun (日) + summon (召) + fire = illuminate (summoning light)
characters.pithy_formula: Light ILLUMINATES the darkness - I COMMAND 'JOW!' banishing shadows!
characters.story: Light ILLUMINATES the room and I COMMAND 'JOW!' with sharp authority banishing shadows. SHINE forth! My bark summons brightness into every dark corner.

characters.narrative_position: In the calm waters that remained, A FISH appeared
characters.etymology: Pictograph of a fish with head, scales, and tail
characters.pithy_formula: The FISH slips through my fingers - I GASP 'YOO?!' Catch it!
characters.story: The FISH slips through my wet fingers! I GASP 'YOO?!' in rising frustration - catch it! My voice climbs as the slippery creature escapes again!

similar_warning.repulsion: 魚 = FISH (the creature); 漁 = FISHING (water + fish = the activity)

characters.narrative_position: People began FISHING — the first meal after the catastrophe
characters.etymology: Water (氵) + fish (魚) = fishing (catching fish in water)
characters.pithy_formula: I'm FISHING in the river - I GASP 'YOO?!' Is something biting?!
characters.story: I'm FISHING in the cold river and GASP 'YOO?!' in rising excitement - is something biting?! My voice climbs as the line tugs, pulling toward the water!

similar_warning.repulsion: 漁 = FISHING (the activity); 魚 = FISH (the creature)

characters.narrative_position: The legendary YÁO brought fever to cook what was caught
characters.etymology: Earth stacked high = Yao (emperor who built civilization high)
characters.pithy_formula: Emperor YAO ruled wisely - I GASP 'YOW?!' at his legendary heights!
characters.story: Emperor YAO ruled from legendary heights! I GASP 'YOW?!' in rising awe at his wisdom. Civilization stacked high - my voice climbs honoring this ancient sage.

characters.narrative_position: The legendary Yáo brought FEVER to cook what was caught
characters.etymology: Fire (火) + Yao (堯) = burn (fire as high as Yao's tower)
characters.pithy_formula: FEVER BURNS through me - I SING 'SHOWWW!' consumed by heat!
characters.story: FEVER BURNS through my body and I SING 'SHOWWW!' in a sustained wail. Heat consumes me - my voice holds high as temperature climbs and climbs!

characters.narrative_position: And at last, DAWN broke — fire and water reconciled in the morning light
characters.etymology: Sun (日) + Yao (堯) = dawn (sun rising high like Yao's wisdom)
characters.pithy_formula: DAWN breaks slowly - I GROAN 'Shyowww...' awakening reluctantly.
characters.story: DAWN breaks slowly and I GROAN 'Shyowww...' in low, creaky reluctance. Waking again - the zombie stirs as light creeps in, my voice dragging toward consciousness.

lesson_palace.location: The Temple of Flood and Fire
lesson_palace.description: A vast elemental temple where water and fire waged war until reconciliation at dawn — rivers flow through stone halls as flames dance on altars

character_stations.川: Three-channel waterfall: streams flow in triple paths
character_stations.州: Island platform: land rises from surrounding water
character_stations.順: Flowing stairs: steps that cascade like water, smooth obedience
character_stations.水: Drowning pool: deep water that pulls you under
character_stations.永: Eternal fountain: water that never stops flowing
character_stations.求: Begging well: where thirsty travelers request water
character_stations.泉: Hidden spring: clear water bubbling from white rock
character_stations.原: Flat courtyard: original plain where springs emerge
character_stations.願: Wishing shrine: place to make wishes
character_stations.沖: Rinsing falls: water that washes everything clean
character_stations.泳: Swimming channel: endless pool for eternal laps
character_stations.洲: Continent map: vast landmass surrounded by oceans
character_stations.沼: Marsh pit: swampy ground that sucks you down
character_stations.沙: Sand beach: waves washing countless grains
character_stations.江: Great river hall: honoring the mighty Yangtze
character_stations.汁: Juice fountain: sweet liquid drips from fruits
character_stations.潮: Tide chamber: water rises and falls mysteriously
character_stations.源: Source cave: where the great river begins
character_stations.活: Life spring: where energy surges through you
character_stations.消: Extinguishing pool: water that makes fire disappear
character_stations.況: Situation room: where conditions are assessed
character_stations.河: River crossing: rushing water blocks the path
character_stations.測: Measuring dock: where depth is fathomed
character_stations.土: Earth pit: dig into cold soil
character_stations.均: Level ground: perfectly equal and flat
character_stations.填: Filling station: holes get filled with earth
character_stations.吐: Retching corner: expelling dirt from mouth
character_stations.哇: Wonder window: views that make you gasp 'wow!'
character_stations.封: Sealing chamber: wax and pressure close envelopes
character_stations.寺: Inner temple: sacred ground for worship
character_stations.時: Time tower: where sun measures the hours
character_stations.火: Fire pit: flames that burn flesh
character_stations.灰: Ash garden: gray remains scatter in wind
character_stations.煩: Frustration forge: where vexation burns the head
character_stations.淡: Dilution basin: where fire meets water = bland
character_stations.照: Illumination hall: light banishes all shadows
character_stations.魚: Fish tank: slippery creatures escape grasp
character_stations.漁: Fishing pier: lines drop into cold water
character_stations.燒: Fever chamber: burning heat consumes you
